column4: how to get list of packges that are in http://pastebin.com/EEcE6bc9
You want a list of just the installed packages?
You mean you want to strip that list down to just the package names?
you could try polity asking someone in #awk to create a regular expression that would parse out the package names
cat (http://pastebin.com/bZJywtKa this list) | xargs sudo aptitude install
dpkg --get-selections > file  then  cat file > dpkg --set-selections  then sudo apt-get dselect-upgrade
what will that command do exactly ? will it reinstall packages that are installed ?
and will install those packages that are not installed ?
this  sudo apt-get dselect-upgrade only upgrade packages ?
That should install the selections that are not currently installed.
so why do you say nope ?
you said ; That should install the selections that are not currently installed. how about selections that are currently installed or purged or ... will reinstall them ?
